author: T Madhavan
text:
It is necessary to promote the use of natural dyes and fibres in the weaving of saris and other cloth, said Carrie Trybulec, Director of Gandhi Memorial Centre in Bethesda, U.S., on Tuesday.

She was on a visit to the weavers’ community in Anakaputhur near Tambaram, as part of community programme she handles at Gandhi Memorial Centre. After depending so much on technology, it is astonishing to know people are relying on natural products to make saris. This knowledge should be definitely shared to promote the importance of natural ingredients,” said Ms. Carrie, who works to share the traditional crafts of India through exhibitions and performances at her U.S. centre. She appreciated the efforts of women weavers who wanted to showcase to the world that using natural fibres was viable, she said. They had plans to display Anakaputhur weavers’ works in a gallery at their centre.

Anakaputhur Weavers Association president C. Sekar said about 25 natural ingredients were used to weave the cloth.
title: U.S. team lauds use of natural dyes
